title: Lethality Meta.......Such Build Diversity..... Much Fun Gameplay...
body:
Count them....
4 Ghostblades, 4 Edge of Nights, 3 Duskblades.
GJ on that Lethality buff.

replies.body:
full AD team :)

Better build armor ... oh they have full lethality + MR + AD items, aaaaaaaannd its gone.
I wish there was an AP + Magic pen + Armor item.
That sounds like an overloaded item.
Yeah the buff they gave edge of night exposed just how overloaded it is, Its at the point now, if you use edge of night wrong its a 20 sec cd.

> [{quoted}](name=Barththkiller,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pkF4WMpH,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-13T17:07:30.715+0000)
>
> Yeah the buff they gave edge of night exposed just how overloaded it is, Its at the point now, if you use edge of night wrong its a 20 sec cd.

Yep the item was a sleeper op before it got buffed. But when Lethality got buffed people started building it and were like OMG now this shit is good. When I first saw the buff to the Edge of Night active cooldown i inwardly sighed and cringed but i wasn't worried because nobody was building it. But now its just fucking aids.
I have a friend who love to adc Jhin, he has now incorporated edge of night into all of his builds for jhin and most adc. Its become to powerful

It's become abused. Again. All assassin/bruiser items end up being abused by ADC and marksmen.

ADCs are the biggest health problem to this game, ever since s1.

> It was made to give many champs a boost at early game so they could survive. 
It wasn't, read what Riot said about the items as they were changing them in the assassin update.

The item isn't the problem, it's how certain champs are using them when they shouldn't.

The kingpin of these are the ADCs:

Bruiser/juggernaut items abused by ADCs in the past: {{item:3053}} {{item:3156}} {{item:3022}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3071}} 

Assassin items:{{item:3142}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3814}} 

The only overlap item between ADCs and assassins should be the {{item:3035}} item line, and both should be final end-game items.

When are ADC items abused? Rarely. Those items are often used for certain "types" of champs rather than "classes." On-hit items are the best example of this. On-hit items being strong ends up being broken for one type of champion(on-hit), but not oneclass. {{item:3124}} meta/fad, for instance, had {{champion:23}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:96}} . How often do champs in any other class build crit? Basically never, unless you take an ADC mid, and even then, most of those don't get crit ({{champion:110}} can, people don't do it anymore though). The exceptions are {{champion:23}} {{champion:157}} who have crit as a part of their niche/design/kit. 

Do not forget there's an entire class devoted to ADCs, the support role.

ADCs seem to have some problem in any sort of meta:

{{item:3071}} {{item:3142}}{{item:3035}}  :{{champion:202}} {{champion:236}} {{champion:21}}(support MF even became a thing) ({{champion:119}} can be on there, w/ Korean meta build)
{{item:3057}} : Ap/AD {{champion:81}} (Runic echoes smite ezreal mid was even meta for a while)
{{item:3153}} {{item:3124}} : {{champion:96}} {{champion:67}} 
{{item:3085}} (it's an ADC item only, but ADCs limit it from being used elsewhere): {{champion:29}} {{champion:222}} {{champion:22}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:429}} 
{{item:3022}} :any of them

So, what ADCs have not been listed into the item abuser category?
{{champion:119}} {{champion:15}} {{champion:22}} {{champion:110}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:133}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:6}} 

How many of those are actually bot lane ADCs?
{{champion:6}} (questionable, but I'll put him here anyways){{champion:119}} {{champion:22}} {{champion:15}} {{champion:110}} 

3/5 of those are just the pure utility ADCs that are meta in LCS(and high elo) and contested picks. Varus being the most recent one. {{champion:6}} is.... obviously fairly unsuited to go bot. But he can go there nonetheless. There hasn't been enough data or experimentation on Urgot bot to draw a conclusion.

Now Marksmen in general:
{{champion:150}} (mini): {{item:3022}} 
{{champion:133}} : does use lethality, but not the more common BC/Yoummus, but Duskblade/Youmuus, which has basically always been part of her. Luc had crit and triforce(spellslinger, which is what he should be) builds, MF had crit builds, and Jhin was using crit until lethality buffs. Draven also used crit, should he be considered one of the lethality abusers. Riot has basically given up on her adcing
{{champion:104}}: ... basically had a overbearing dominance in top and jg for quite a long time last season. Abuses juggernaut items, as well as youmuus, Death's Dance, Phantom dancer... he's like a ADC tank. Almost like Urgot.
{{champion:42}} : moved to mid, and he's sorta become like a mage. I can't speak for him because I don't really know much about it. Supposedly really annoying to deal with in high elo. He's still entirely dependant on {{item:3078}} . 
{{champion:6}} honestly isn't really much of a marksmen. An AD caster? He's getting a rework...
{{champion:268}} : Bullies early, hypercarry lategame. I **think** Riot said he was a failure like Kalista, but I'm unsure. Eitherway, he's always contested in LCS like Kalista, unless he's nerfed out of LCS, which ends up with him being gutted out of soloQ. He did abuse Rylai's. 
{{champion:126}} : isn't really a marksmen, even in ranged form. If you do want to see his issues, there are a _lot_ of threads. Right now, he abuses youmuus/BC, but I don't count him as a marksmen.
{{champion:85}} : Rylai's/Protobelt, but mostly the latter. He's been nerfed out of the meta. 
{{champion:203}} is an "adc", but in jg and not bot, so I didn't want to include her/him/it. Kindred also depends on {{item:3085}} {{item:3022}} . Looks like people are starting to get cleaver on her too.
{{champion:17}} : Currently also abuses {{item:3022}} {{item:3085}} . Historically, he has often used {{item:3115}} (which never was a problematic item because of how very few champs would buy it), and {{item:3151}}

I don't know enough info about Maw to recall why it was created. I know it dated really far back, though. 

Sterak was made exclusively for juggernauts, in the juggernaut update. It amplified base attack, and didn't add bonus AD, to ensure that it wouldn't be abused by ADCs or assassins. Only juggernauts would scale nicely with an increase in base AD, and not additive bonus AD. 

Mallet is mostly used by the top lane ADCs and marksmen. Gnar, and Teemo being the most common users.

Ez gets IBG because he already has good range and kiting for an adc. It gives him an unnecessary amount of self-peel. He's an ADC, meant to be squishy and killed by anything unless he plays it safe. IBG allowed him to play a lot more aggressively without punishment, which shouldn't happen. It is only abused on Ezreal. Ezreal abuses all sheen items, which sucks for other champs that want to use them. IBG, Triforce, and Lich Bane. At least Corki only uses Triforce.

Cleaver is used in every lane now. Mid lane assassins, top lane everything(they basically made juggernauts have to buy black cleaver), bot lane ADCs. Only supports don't get it.

You're probably right about youmuus pre-rework being an item for adcs. But it was a niche item. After rework, it was geared only for assassins. There's no reason for ADCs to be buying it. They removed so many ADC benefits from youmuus, and they [ADCs] still buy the item a lot.

I mentioned those items.

Botrk/Rageblade are for onhit champions, not just ADCs or marksmen. This includes melee champs as well. Examples are Jax, and pre-rework Warwick. Kayle or Voli would buy it, but they have better item choices (Nashor's Tooth, Titanic Hydra, respectively, wit's end for both of them) now. Yasuo was designed around crit, as I also mentioned in the earlier response. He and Trynd will depend on crit.

When they reworked GP, I don't know what they had in mind for him. I know they wanted him to build Triforce, but I don't know about Crit. Prob should rewatch the champion spotlight; those items give a good idea of what Riot "wanted" for a certain item or champion. If youmuus wasn't featured as an item for ADCs in the older champion spotlights, it likely wasn't meant to be used for them. If youmuus was often recommended to assassins in their champion spotlights, it was probably designed for them.

You're right about Zed using Bloodthirster. Not just him, basically every AD champion used BT as the final AD item in the end. Even then, it wasn't good on most of them(if they weren't ADCs), but they still bought them when they could(Zed also had Botrk and Ravenous Hydra). 

So, where would this put BT. 
"Abused by all AD champions." In that case, the user list is so broad, it's not abuse. I'm leaning towards saying the same thing for Death's Dance. I forgot which champion updated they added that in, but I believe it was the ADC one.

As mentioned in the earlier post, I also believe ADC should only be bot lane carries. Riot has gotten rid of "adc" and replaced it with "marksmen," so I opted to use their definition instead.

Poppy is a fighter. poppy  gets defensive steriods  for being low hp that most melee champions dont have . dont use poppy as your base for tanks or fighters.
 adcs are faster than poppy and nearly every other melee champion with out a shit ton of low cooldown dashes on their main damage skills and so are mages with {{item:3086}}  and {{item:3113}}  items.
lethality was not made for adcs and was specficly made to stop adcs who were already building armor penetration from building it along with stopping assassin from snowballing to easily
against an all AD team... no one is even running tabis.. or frozen heart... yea i feel no sympathy for you

> [{quoted}](name=Ultra Rapid Fyre,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pkF4WMpH,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-02-13T16:43:44.575+0000)
>
> against an all AD team... no one is even running tabis.. or frozen heart... yea i feel no sympathy for you

FH would be worthless here because none of them are aa'ing that much to begin, same with Tabi. 

~~~Let's also completely ingore the fact that Eve and Kled built a Randuin's and DMP. Veigar had Zhonya's and a chain vest. Nami had Warden's mail and Locket. MF built a Randuin's AND had a Tabi.~~~
I forgot that 80 armor was useless against full AD.
80 Armor, No HP, and a barely useful passive. woo. Deadman's would be better.

They have tons of armor. Why would specifically  Tabi and Frozen heart help? imho, their mistakes are other things in their builds, like Evelynn focusing on tankiness, MF's tabjis and mortal reminder, the 3 Randuin's (anti-crit and anti-aa??), possibly Kled's build... Also from each champion's K/D/A, it appears they never grouped and pushed mid. I'm calling loss well deserved.
I like how he only blacked out the names on the scoreboard, The top-right not a single name was censored.
Kinda funny, blacked out the summoner names on the left, kept them on the right :P
I wanted to comment this. I kek'd a bit.
I'm pretty sure that loss is deserved, for having no real tank and your teammates thinking that a randuins suddenly makes them tanky. Also, why the hell do you have a negatron dude?

> [{quoted}](name=SmileInABox,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pkF4WMpH,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2017-02-13T17:40:16.650+0000)
>
>  Also, why the hell do you have a negatron dude?

There's this magical item called GA, maybe you should read up on it.
You don't start with Negatron when building GA if you are against full AD team. You start with chain vest.

> [{quoted}](name=duckarp,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pkF4WMpH,comment-id=000500000001,timestamp=2017-02-14T11:27:54.227+0000)
>
> You don't start with Negatron when building GA if you are against full AD team. You start with chain vest.

Are you blind? He has a chain vest sitting in his inventory already.
Yeah, cuz thats gonna help.
Yeah, you really ought to read up on it.
GA isn't helpful when behind. You get *booped* in one second, and *booped* again 2 seconds later, while being taken out of the fight for that duration
You realize that just because something builds Tank or AD, it doesn't mean they don't deal magic damage. So the MR wouldn't be that useless while the item provides weaker Zilean ulti and Armor.
people seem to forget varus actually has %hp magic damage, and if he took dft as well thats even more.
That varus had 4/8, he obviously wasn't the problem in that game. Zed, Rengar and Wu were the offenders.

zed also does 10% max hp magic damage from his passive (yeah its that much), and rengar and wu have their w's and probably took thunderlords along with Zed, which again is magic damage.
Its not a ton, but it is enough to say that the mr isnt a complete waste especially when zed and wu have a pretty big cd to blow in a fight to be useful making GA really decent against both in later game

Ok, so you have an Lv 18 dude with around 93 armor 9 from runes, and 125 from items (full build being {{item:3047}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3053}} ) you got a total of 225 armor. 225- {{item:3071}} =  157.5 armor- 50 Lethality from items + 8.5 from masteries and 14.4 from runes(marks) (equal to 72.9 Lethality) so 157.5-72.9 = 84.6 armor which is the same as an unarmored champion. 

Ouch.

> [{quoted}](name=DragonShea,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pkF4WMpH,comment-id=0012,timestamp=2017-02-13T23:55:36.811+0000)
>
> Ok, so you have an Lv 18 dude with around 93 armor 9 from runes, and 125 from items (full build being {{item:3047}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3053}} ) you got a total of 225 armor. 225- {{item:3071}} =  157.5 armor- 50 Lethality from items + 8.5 from masteries and 14.4 from runes(marks) (equal to 72.9 Lethality) so 157.5-72.9 = 84.6 armor which is the same as an unarmored champion. 
> 
> Ouch.

Or swap out the visage for a randuin's and now they tickle you.
and then you have 0 MR to deal with the support zyra/brand who also deals a ton of damage

> [{quoted}](name=DragonShea,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pkF4WMpH,comment-id=0012,timestamp=2017-02-13T23:55:36.811+0000)
>
> Ok, so you have an Lv 18 dude with around 93 armor 9 from runes, and 125 from items (full build being {{item:3047}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3053}} ) you got a total of 225 armor. 225- {{item:3071}} =  157.5 armor- 50 Lethality from items + 8.5 from masteries and 14.4 from runes(marks) (equal to 72.9 Lethality) so 157.5-72.9 = 84.6 armor which is the same as an unarmored champion. 
> 
> Ouch.

I forgot to add this is without Last whisper

The problem is fucking longswords. Why can AD champions buy like 6 and make use of them for a core item, but AP items can't spam amplifying tomes?

And why are long swords so fucking cheap?
you blacked out the names but you forgot to black out the other names and the names in the chatbox
Hmmmm AD casters building lethality.  Well that's just wrong, they should fix that, I dont get why they aren't stacking ap.  Riot??

There's nothing wrong with it, but the problem is when that is the best thing to have on more than half of your team, and half of the enemy team.

Also notable is that AD casters are using Assassin items better than most assassins. This is a good indicator something is wrong, having ADC's prioritize Assassin stats over Marksmen stats (Crit and Attack Speed, which they may get, but generally not untill the second half of their build).

AD Casters have always used armor penetration over other stats, because that's what makes their abilities do the most damage.  I'm not even talking about how balanced the stat is right now, because it probably needs tuning.  Ad assassins are AD casters,  AD poke champs are AD casters, Everything that is ad and relies on their abilities is an AD caster.
Please tell me how Corki and Ezreal are prioritizing it then, since it makes AD casters do more damage.

Ezreal's abilities all do magic damage besides his q, so he builds items that strengthen his q.  Muramana, Triforce, bork, etc.  And similar to Ezreal, Corki just straight up does mostly magic damage, hence spell pen boots and void staff.  Really just have to open your eyes for the answers bud, pretty easy to understand.

Neiher of those PRIOTIZE penetration.
Ez builds maybe one of the LW items.
Corki builds one pen item in his boots.

Absurdly different from Assassins and a number of ADC's building 3 Lethality items.

Really just have to open your eyes for the reading comprehension bud, pretty easy to understand.
I literally just explained to you why they don't prioritize lethality LOL.

So you agree that I was right and you were wrong when you stated "AD Casters have always used armor penetration over other stats" and I mentioned those two? Fine by me, and good on you admitting a mistake.

They are different from other ad casters because their abilities do primarily magic damage.  You arent going to build armor pen when your abilities do magic damage.  Ezreals only build to empower their q, and on-hit does a much better job than lethality.  They are ad casters but they are completely different.  Does that make sense to you mow?  You are wrong please try to read.

They are still AD CASTERS. So you were STILL wrong when you said "AD Caster have always used armor penetration" and actually go on to prove that is wrong. They USUALLY do, however SOME AD CASTERS DO NOT, meaning they **Don't "ALWAYS" use Armor Penetration**

You made a mistake, which while mostly semantics, is STILL INCORRECT.  You just are unable to accept it, or maybe just not able to look at things from any other angle than what you see straight up.

Have a nice day.

There's also the fact that even before this trend when AD champs did go the armor pen route... they didn't go full pen.... they simply got 1-2 pen items to round out a 6 item build to stay relevant in the late game. Now with 3 items that give move speed, lethality, high AD, and active/passive addons. I could understand 1 item that has all of those things.... but 3?! The items are overloaded. If they want to keep the items as they are atm.... then they are going to need to give armor items more armor. The easier balance to do is to nerf lethality back how it was. They went from 40% to 60%.... what was wrong with trying 50% first.
Maybe because everyone and their mother is building it, and using it way too effectively?

If you are an ad champion and you cast ablities as your main source of damage, you should be itemizing armor penetration.  Lethality can use some nerfs, no one is even arguing that.  But this thread is retarded for saying that there is no build diversity when legit all of them are ad casters and should be itemizing armor penetration.  If you want build diversity introduce more items, but then there will be way too much lethality.
